arts.ttl: ‘It’s been stressful - I won’t lie’ - David Livermore reflects on caretaker spell in charge of Millwall
arts.sum: The former Southend captain has decided to pursue new opportunities within management after an eight-year spell on the Millwall coaching team. He said: “The guy is a leader, he was the captain of every team he played for.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard provides disappointing injury update on in-form Coventry City man as Haji Wright eyes return
arts.sum: Coventry City have been dealt a significant injury blow with the news that in-form Ephron Mason-Clark will be out for a number of “weeks” with a hamstring strain suffered against Plymouth on Boxing Day. Asked how Wright and Mason-Clark are doing with their respective injuries, the City boss said: “Well, Haji is hopefully back on the training pitch with us in early January.

arts.ttl: David Livermore signs off Millwall caretaker boss stint with ‘solid point’ at Coventry City
arts.sum: “I just felt it was important today that we came away from here with something, the effort the lads put in having played just three days ago was fantastic. We would like to have been a bit more of an attacking threat and shown a bit more of that side of us, but to come away with a point was a good result for us.

arts.ttl: Millwall confirm departure of first-team coach Adam Barrett
arts.sum: I have been lucky enough to work with some fantastic players and staff across the entire club and can’t thank them enough, as well as the fans, for their support. Adam Barrett has left his role as Millwall first-team coach.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings with scores from 4 to 7 as Sky Blues frustrated
arts.sum: The first half was a desperately dull affair at the CBS Arena that produced one measly shot on target for the Sky Blues – a decent chance in the box from Ben Sheaf who hit his effort too close to the goalkeeper – on a day when the injured Ephron Mason-Clark’s presence was greatly missed. Played Rudoni into the box for a great chance early in the second half as City upped their game.

arts.ttl: Coventry and Millwall settle for a point apiece in dull stalemate at CBS Arena
arts.sum: Alex Neil looks set to take over as Lions boss.

arts.ttl: Injury blow as Frank Lampard has names his Coventry City team to face Millwall
arts.sum: City: Oliver Dovin; Milan Van Ewijk, Bobby Thomas, Joel Latibeaudiere, Jake Bidwell; Josh Eccles, Ben Sheaf; Tatsuhiro Sakamoto, Victor Torp, Jack Rudoni; Norman Bassette. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: Coventry City v Millwall live updates and team news from the CBS Arena
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. Interim boss David Livermore has said he will remain in charge for today's game at Coventry, which will be his third game in the hotseat, having overseen a home win over Blackburn and Boxing Day defeat at Norwich.

arts.ttl: Millwall agree deal for Alex Neil to be new head coach
arts.sum: Neil has managed 467 matches at five clubs, with his first posting at Hamilton in April 2013. Neil has also bossed Preston North End and was at their match on Boxing Day, a 1-0 victory over Hull City.

Josh Eccles was at the heart of a dominant Coventry performance on Boxing Day as the Sky Blues returned to winning ways with a 4-0 victory against a struggling Plymouth side. Frank Lampard's men hav...
